net.joala.bdd.reference

Class References

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.joala.bdd.reference.References

  • public final class References
extends Object

    Factory methods for creating references. These factory methods are meant to provide a shortcut to create new instances.

    Since:
    9/27/12
    See Also:
    net.joala.bdd

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> Reference<T> ref()
      Factory method for simple (unlogged) references.
      static <T> Reference<T> ref(String name)
      Create a reference which is self-describing.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • ref

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Reference<T> ref()

        Factory method for simple (unlogged) references.

        Usage:
        
 Reference<String> myString = References.ref();
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of value contained in the reference
        Returns:
        a reference

      • ref

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Reference<T> ref(String name)

        Create a reference which is self-describing. This is especially meant to be used together with steps logging. If you want to have silent (not logged) references use ref() instead.

        Usage:
        
 Reference<String> myString = References.ref("aName");
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of value contained in the reference
        Parameters:
        name - the name (or description) of the reference used for logging
        Returns:
        a reference
        See Also:
        ref()
